text: Hi. I guess this is a feature request. At first, I misunderstood the aim of `@def reeval = true`. I see now that it forces the execution of all blocks, regardless of them being modified or not, right? But that is not what I was actually in need of. For the sake of organizing some of the post (specially those that are not about the underlying code, but about the math itself), I put the code at the end, so I need to get the page compiled twice to effectively see the changes. It is not a big deal to just change part of the text to have that effect, but it would be nicer to just tell Franklin to go over the file twice so it updates the code outputs properly (it doesn’t need to reevaluate the codes since they will not be changed, it is just for the sake of getting the output right). It should be a local variable as well, which defaults to false, but that we could add to specific pages with say `@def passtwice = true`. Is it easy to do something like this?
